summary: This bill, the "Territorial Tax Equity and Economic Growth Act of 2025," seeks to boost the economies of U.S. possessions like Puerto Rico and Guam by amending the Internal Revenue Code. It modifies the "substantial presence" test for determining bona fide residency and refines how income is sourced for residents of these territories. Specifically, it clarifies the tax treatment of income from U.S. business activities. These changes aim to provide tax equity and encourage economic investment in the territories, effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
